      • Public Function GetColumnIndexOnName(sColName As String, rngTableHeader As Range) As Integer

        Public Function GetColumnIndexOnName(sColName As String, rngTableHeader As Range) As Integer
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : getColumnIndexOnName
        ' Author : Nitin Dhaware
        ' Date : 3/15/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the column index when column name and table header range are passed as argument.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Column name--Name of the column of which you are seeking the index from table header range.
        ' * Table header range--The header range in which column name is to be looked up.
        ' Returns: Integer
        ' * Number--Indicating the index of the column in context of the header range.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------
        'Public Function GetColumnIndexOnName(sColName As String, rngTableHeader As Range) As Integer
        ' Dim iResult As Integer
        ' Dim sCellValue As String, rngCell As Range
        ' For Each rngCell In rngTableHeader.Cells
        ' sCellValue = rngCell
        ' If StrComp(sCellValue, sColName, vbTextCompare) = 0 Then
        ' iResult = rngCell.Column - rngTableHeader.Cells(1, 1).Column + 1
        ' Exit For
        ' End If
        ' Next
        ' GetColumnIndexOnName = iResult
        'End Function

        ' Parameters:
        ' * Table header range--The header range from which column indices are to be retrieved.
        ' Returns: Collection
        ' * Collection of indices--containing indices as items and column names as key values.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetColumnRangeOnColumnNames(bwt As BoardwalkTable, vntColumnNames As Variant) As Range

        Public Function GetColumnRangeOnColumnNames(bwt As BoardwalkTable, vntColumnNames As Variant) As Range
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetColumnRangeOnColumnNames
        ' Author : Sanghapal Bhowate
        ' Date : 6/9/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the column range given a boardwalk table and the column names as array.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Boardwalk table--In which the column names are to be looked for.
        ' * Column names--That constitute an array.
        ' Returns: Range
        ' * Column range--That is made up of the column ranges of the corresponding column names passed as argument.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetLookUpRange(rngLookUp As Range, sLookUpVal As String, rngSource As Range) As Range

        Public Function GetLookUpRange(rngLookUp As Range, sLookUpVal As String, rngSource As Range) As Range
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetLookUpRange
        ' Author : Nitin Dhaware
        ' Date : 6/4/2011
        ' Purpose : This function looks for the lookup value in lookup column and gets the corresponding range from the source column.
        ' For example:
        ' Lookup column range contains regions ("North","North-West")
        ' Lookup value is "North-West"
        ' Source column range has "Main Office","Accounts Dept" for "North" region and "Sales Dept","Purchase Dept" for "North-West" region.
        ' Thus the function gets range that contains "Sales Dept" and "Purchase Dept".
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Lookup Column range--In which the lookup value needs to be looked for.
        ' * Lookup value--The value that needs to be looked for in the lookup column range.
        ' * Source column range--from which the corresponding range needs to be retrieved.
        ' Returns: Range
        ' * Corresponding range--That corresponds to the lookup column.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetRangeCollectionOnColumnNames(bwt As BoardwalkTable, vntColNames As Variant) As Collection

        Public Function GetRangeCollectionOnColumnNames(bwt As BoardwalkTable, vntColNames As Variant) As Collection
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetRangeCollectionOnColumnNames
        ' Author : Nitin Dhaware
        ' Date : 6/8/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the column ranges in a collection given the names of the columns and boardwalk table.
        ' The returned collection contains column range as item and corresponding column name as its key.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Boardwalk table--In which the column names are to be looked for.
        ' * Column names--That constitute an array.
        ' Returns: Collection
        ' * Collection of column range--Where the column range is stored as an item along with the column name as its key.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetSortedUniqueValues(rngSortCol As Range, sSortOrder As String, Optional rngSortAssociated As Range, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As String

        Public Function GetSortedUniqueValues(rngSortCol As Range, sSortOrder As String, Optional rngSortAssociated As Range, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As String
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetSortedUniqueValues
        ' Author : Nitin Dhaware
        ' Date : 7/5/2011
        ' Purpose : This function sorts a given column range and returns a string that contains unique values from the same range.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Column range--The range of a single column that needs to be sorted and looked up for unique values.
        ' * Associated Range--The associated range that will get sorted with the column.
        ' * Sort order--The string that has "Asc" or "Desc" or "None".
        ' * Optional ignore case flag--The optional flag that indicates whether case must ignored or not while retrieving unique values.
        ' Returns: String
        ' * Comma separated string--The string contains comma separated unique values that will be retrieved from the column range.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetUniqueValueCollectionFromBWColumn(bwt As BoardwalkTable, sColName As String, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As Collection

        Public Function GetUniqueValueCollectionFromBWColumn(bwt As BoardwalkTable, sColName As String, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As Collection
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetUniqueValueCollectionFromBWColumn
        ' Author : Sandhya Murkute
        ' Date : 6/4/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the unique values from a boardwalk column into a collection given a boardwalk table and corresponding boardwalk column name.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Boardwalk table--In which column is to be looked for.
        ' * Column name--That is to be looked through to gather unique values.
        ' * Optional ignore case flag--When true, case sensetive uniqueness is checked.
        ' That is, both "abc" and "Abc" will be returned in the collection.
        ' When false, case insensetive uniqueness is considered.
        ' That is, Either "abc" or "Abc" will be returned in the collection and other will be skipped.
        ' Returns: Collection
        ' * Collection of strings--With the unique values contained in the range.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetUniqueValueCollectionFromColumn(rngColumn As Range, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As Collection

        Public Function GetUniqueValueCollectionFromColumn(rngColumn As Range, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As Collection
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetUniqueValueCollectionFromColumn
        ' Author : Sanghapal Bhowate
        ' Date : 6/2/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the unique values from a range into a collection given a column range.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Column range--That contains only one column as range.
        ' * Optional ignore case flag--When true, case sensetive uniqueness is checked.
        ' That is, both "abc" and "Abc" will be returned in the collection.
        ' When false, case insensetive uniqueness is considered.
        ' That is, Either "abc" or "Abc" will be returned in the collection and other will be skipped.
        ' Returns: Collection
        ' * Collection of strings--With the unique values contained in the range.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetUniqueValueStringFromBWColumn(bwt As BoardwalkTable, sColName As String, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As String

        Public Function GetUniqueValueStringFromBWColumn(bwt As BoardwalkTable, sColName As String, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As String
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetUniqueValueStringFromBWColumn
        ' Author : Sanghapal Bhowate
        ' Date : 6/6/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the unique values from a boardwalk column listed out as comma separated string.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Boardwalk table--In which column is to be looked for.
        ' * Column name--That is to be looked through to gather unique values.
        ' * Optional ignore case flag--When true, case sensetive uniqueness is checked.
        ' That is, both "abc" and "Abc" will be returned in the collection.
        ' When false, case insensetive uniqueness is considered.
        ' That is, Either "abc" or "Abc" will be returned in the collection and other will be skipped.
        ' Returns: String
        ' * Comma separated values--That contains the unique values.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function GetUniqueValueStringFromColumn(rngColumn As Range, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As String

        Public Function GetUniqueValueStringFromColumn(rngColumn As Range, Optional bIgnoreCase As Boolean = True) As String
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : GetUniqueValueStringFromColumn
        ' Author : Sanghapal Bhowate
        ' Date : 6/6/2011
        ' Purpose : This function gets the unique values from a range given the column range.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Column range--That contains only one column as range.
        ' * Optional ignore case flag--When true, case sensetive uniqueness is checked.
        ' That is, both "abc" and "Abc" will be returned in the collection.
        ' When false, case insensetive uniqueness is considered.
        ' That is, Either "abc" or "Abc" will be returned in the collection and other will be skipped.
        ' Returns: String
        ' * Comma separated values--That contains the unique values.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Sub InsertColumn(bwt As BoardwalkTable, Optional bAtEndOfTheTable As Boolean = False)

        Public Sub InsertColumn(bwt As BoardwalkTable, Optional bAtEndOfTheTable As Boolean = False)
        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : InsertColumn
        ' Author : Siddhant Chothe
        ' Date : 4/7/2011
        ' Purpose : This subprocedure Allows to insert a single column to left of selected boardwalk column or at end of the boardwalk table.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Boardwalk table--The boardwalk table in which column is to be inserted.
        ' * Insert at end flag--True to insert at end and false to insert to the left of selection.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Public Function MultipleColumnsSelected(bwt As BoardwalkTable) As Boolean

        Details:

        '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        ' Procedure : MultipleColumnsSelected
        ' Author : Siddhant Chothe
        ' Date : 4/7/2011
        ' Purpose : This function indicates whether multiple columns are selected within a boardwalk table.
        ' Parameters:
        ' * Boardwalk table--The boardwalk table inside which selection is to be checked.
        ' Returns: Boolean
        ' * True--When multiple columns or multiple areas are selected.
        ' * False--When single column is selected.
        '------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------
